list_definition.definition: a senior pupil who helps to see that school rules are kept.

any of several kinds of instrument etc by means of which something can be constantly checked, especially a small screen in a television studio showing the picture which is being transmitted at any given time
to act as, or to use, a monitor; to keep a careful check on

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: These machines/technicians monitor the results constantly.

list_ex_of_english: The eluent was monitored at a wavelength of 254 nm.
Farmers to be monitored are chosen to represent dierent situations of soil and water resource availability and socio-economic circumstances.
In addition, experiments were monitored as a function of phage progeny release rather than turbidity decline.
Individual survival was monitored three times a week.
External field supervision was carried out by three independent supervisors who monitored ongoing fieldwork logistics and data quality during the data collection period.
Migration of cells into denuded areas was monitored for up to 48 hours.
With the help of a semi-structured questionnaire, the far ms were monitored twice - two months and one year after planting.
All vaccine recipients were monitored for clinical signs and symptoms for s e v e n days after each inoculation.
